Question: According to this person, spontaneity and chance are causes of some things, distinguishable from other types of cause.
Hints: This person's metaphysics contains observations on the nature of numbers but he made no original contributions to mathematics.
Ayn Rand accredited this person as "the greatest philosopher in history" and cited him as a major influence on her thinking.
This person disagreed with Plato on this point, arguing that all universals are instantiated.
